data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Dibrugarh, Assam, India. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Dibrugarh, Assam, India
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, comfort those who mourn in Dibrugarh, Assam, India.
data.verse: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.

data.section_summary: On average, 107 people will die without Jesus in the next 100 hours in Dibrugarh, Assam, India.
data.prayer: Jesus, send your gospel to these.
Father, help 265 new simple churches start among the 1,326,300 people in the county of Dibrugarh, Assam, India. One within reach of everyone living here.
data.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord as the waters cover the sea.

data.prayer: Father, help the 14,589 believers in Dibrugarh to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 1,311,710 lost friends and neighbors.
Spirit, I pray that the Koch (Muslim traditions) people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Father, please remove the barriers that keep the 1,295,618 who are far from you in Dibrugarh, Assam, India from having access to a Bible.
data.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

data.prayer: Father, encourage the 14,589 believers to have boldness before you, since they have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God.
data.verse: Since then we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.

data.prayer: Please, convict the 14,589 believers in Dibrugarh, Assam, India to look to you as their only hope for strength and fruitfulness and life.
data.verse: "I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.
